intro: Aeschynomene megalophylla, commonly known as large-leaf aeschynomene, is a flowering plant species native to tropical regions of Africa and South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant is known for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, which makes it valuable in soil enrichment and agricultural settings. It typically grows as an erect annual herb with hairy stems and is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats.
